metadata.title: How to Set Up YouTube Channel Memberships 2025: Complete Guide
metadata.description: Create channel memberships on YouTube. Requirements, pricing tiers, perks, and strategies for recurring revenue.

hero.headline: How to Set Up YouTube Channel Memberships
hero.subheadline: Create recurring revenue with loyal fans. Everything you need to know about YouTube memberships.

sections.content: Channel memberships let your biggest fans support you monthly in exchange for perks like custom emoji, badges, and exclusive content. It's predictable recurring revenue that doesn't depend on views or ad rates. Here's how to set up and optimize your membership program.

content.title: Custom Emoji
content.description: Members-only emoji for live chat and comments. Visible badge of membership.

content.title: Loyalty Badges
content.description: Badges that show membership duration. Recognition builds community.

content.title: Members-Only Content
content.description: Exclusive videos, posts, and live streams. Premium content for paying fans.

sections.title: Membership Requirements
content: Be in the YouTube Partner Program
Channel not set as made for kids

sections.title: How to Set Up Memberships
content: Go to YouTube Studio > Earn > Memberships

faq.question: How much does YouTube take from memberships?
faq.answer: YouTube takes 30% of membership revenue. You keep 70%. So a $4.99 membership nets you about $3.49.

faq.question: What should I price tiers at?
faq.answer: Common tiers: $0.99 (entry), $4.99 (standard), $9.99+ (premium). Match perks to price. Don't overpromise.

faq.question: How do I get members to join?
faq.answer: Remind viewers in videos, create compelling perks, show member benefits, celebrate members publicly. Consistency matters more than promotion.

faq.question: What if I can't deliver perks?
faq.answer: Start simple. Custom emoji and badges require no extra work. Add members-only content as you can sustain it. Don't burn out.
